title: Worm
data:
The **worm** is a [monster class](/wiki/Monster_class "Monster class") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*, and is represented by the lowercase [w](/wiki/W "W") glyph (w). Worms are designated internally by the macro **S\_WORM**.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

The class contains the following monsters:[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

- w [baby long worm](/wiki/Baby_long_worm "Baby long worm")
- w [long worm](/wiki/Long_worm "Long worm")
- w [baby purple worm](/wiki/Baby_purple_worm "Baby purple worm")
- w [purple worm](/wiki/Purple_worm "Purple worm")

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Common traits](#Common_traits)
  - [1.1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 History](#History)

- [3 Variants](#Variants)

  - [3.1 NetHack: The Next Generation](#NetHack:_The_Next_Generation)
  - [3.2 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [3.3 UnNetHack](#UnNetHack)
  - [3.4 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [3.5 SpliceHack](#SpliceHack)
  - [3.6 EvilHack](#EvilHack)
  - [3.7 SlashTHEM](#SlashTHEM)
  - [3.8 Hack'EM](#Hack.27EM)

- [4 References](#References)

## Common traits

All worms are [slithy](/wiki/Slithy "Slithy"), [carnivorous](/wiki/Carnivorous "Carnivorous") [animals](/wiki/Animal "Animal") that are [large](/wiki/Large "Large") or bigger and have no limbs. Adult worms are [gigantic](/wiki/Gigantic "Gigantic"), [oviparous](/wiki/Oviparous "Oviparous"), [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong"), and considered [nasty](/wiki/M2_NASTY "M2 NASTY") as well. Worms generally attack using bites.

### Generation

Randomly generated worms are always generated hostile.

## History

A possible ancestor for the long worm appears in the mega-worm of Hack 1.21, based on [Jay Fenlason's Hack](/wiki/Jay_Fenlason%27s_Hack "Jay Fenlason's Hack"). The long worm and purple worm themselves appear in Hack for PDP-11, and both are included in the bestiary for [Hack 1.0](/wiki/Hack_1.0 "Hack 1.0"). [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0") introduces the baby forms of both worms.

## Variants

### NetHack: The Next Generation

In [NetHack: The Next Generation](/wiki/NetHack:_The_Next_Generation "NetHack: The Next Generation"), the artifact [Wormbiter](/index.php?title=Wormbiter\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Wormbiter (page does not exist)") is a [crysknife](/wiki/Crysknife "Crysknife") that has +5 [to-hit](/wiki/To-hit "To-hit") and deals double damage against worms.

### SLASH'EM

[SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") adds several monsters to the monster class:

- w [larva](/wiki/Larva "Larva")
- w [maggot](/wiki/Maggot "Maggot")
- w [dung worm](/wiki/Dung_worm "Dung worm")
- w [acid worm](/wiki/Acid_worm "Acid worm")
- w [bloodworm](/wiki/Bloodworm "Bloodworm")
- w [tunnel worm](/wiki/Tunnel_worm "Tunnel worm")
- w [rot worm](/wiki/Rot_worm "Rot worm")

Four random worms are generated in [The Wyrm Caves](/wiki/The_Wyrm_Caves "The Wyrm Caves") at level creation.

### UnNetHack

In [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"), various worms are generated on each level of the [Dragon Caves](/wiki/Dragon_Caves "Dragon Caves") at level creation.

### dNetHack

[dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") adds several monsters to the monster class:

- w [dark worm](/wiki/Dark_worm "Dark worm")
- w [hunting horror](/wiki/Hunting_horror "Hunting horror")
- w [wide clubbed tentacle](/index.php?title=Wide_clubbed_tentacle\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Wide clubbed tentacle (page does not exist)")
- w [worm that walks](/index.php?title=Worm_that_walks_\(dNetHack\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Worm that walks (dNetHack) (page does not exist)")
- w [parasitic mind flayer](/index.php?title=Parasitic_mind_flayer\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Parasitic mind flayer (page does not exist)")
- w [parasitic master mind flayer](/index.php?title=Parasitic_master_mind_flayer\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Parasitic master mind flayer (page does not exist)")
- w [long sinuous tentacle](/index.php?title=Long_sinuous_tentacle\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Long sinuous tentacle (page does not exist)")
- w [crimson writher](/index.php?title=Crimson_writher\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Crimson writher (page does not exist)")

The tentacle 'monsters' in the worm monster class act as "animate" body parts of another monster: they occupy their own square, and can be targeted independently.

Several worms are generated on the locate level of the [Drow Noble quest](/wiki/Drow_Noble_quest "Drow Noble quest") at level creation.

### SpliceHack

[SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack") adds one monster to the monster class:

- w [maggot](/index.php?title=Maggot_\(SpliceHack\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Maggot (SpliceHack) (page does not exist)")

### EvilHack

[EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack") adds two monsters to the monster class:

- w [giant leech](/wiki/Giant_leech "Giant leech")
- w [neothelid](/wiki/Neothelid_\(EvilHack\) "Neothelid (EvilHack)")

### SlashTHEM

In addition to SLASH'EM details, [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM") adds Wormbiter from NetHack: The Next Generation.

### Hack'EM

[Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM") adds many monsters to the monster class, including several from other variants:

- w [larva](/wiki/Larva "Larva")
- w [maggot](/wiki/Maggot "Maggot")
- w [dung worm](/wiki/Dung_worm "Dung worm")
- w [acid worm](/wiki/Acid_worm "Acid worm")
- w [bloodworm](/wiki/Bloodworm "Bloodworm")
- w [tunnel worm](/wiki/Tunnel_worm "Tunnel worm")
- w [rot worm](/wiki/Rot_worm "Rot worm")
- w [giant leech](/wiki/Giant_leech "Giant leech")
- w [neothelid](/wiki/Neothelid_\(EvilHack\) "Neothelid (EvilHack)")
- w [hellminth](/index.php?title=Hellminth\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Hellminth (page does not exist)")

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [include/monsym.h in NetHack 3.6.7, line 37](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/include/monsym.h#L37)
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/monst.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 911](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/monst.c#L911)

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")
html:
Worm

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

The worm is a monster class that appears in NetHack, and is represented by the lowercase w glyph (w). Worms are designated internally by the macro S_WORM.[1]

The class contains the following monsters:[2]

  • w baby long worm
  • w long worm
  • w baby purple worm
  • w purple worm

Contents

  • 1 Common traits
    • 1.1 Generation
  • 2 History
  • 3 Variants
    • 3.1 NetHack: The Next Generation
    • 3.2 SLASH'EM
    • 3.3 UnNetHack
    • 3.4 dNetHack
    • 3.5 SpliceHack
    • 3.6 EvilHack
    • 3.7 SlashTHEM
    • 3.8 Hack'EM
  • 4 References

Common traits

All worms are slithy, carnivorous animals that are large or bigger and have no limbs. Adult worms are gigantic, oviparous, strong, and considered nasty as well. Worms generally attack using bites.

Generation

Randomly generated worms are always generated hostile.

History

A possible ancestor for the long worm appears in the mega-worm of Hack 1.21, based on Jay Fenlason's Hack. The long worm and purple worm themselves appear in Hack for PDP-11, and both are included in the bestiary for Hack 1.0. NetHack 3.0.0 introduces the baby forms of both worms.

Variants

NetHack: The Next Generation

In NetHack: The Next Generation, the artifact Wormbiter is a crysknife that has +5 to-hit and deals double damage against worms.

SLASH'EM

SLASH'EM adds several monsters to the monster class:

  • w larva
  • w maggot
  • w dung worm
  • w acid worm
  • w bloodworm
  • w tunnel worm
  • w rot worm

Four random worms are generated in The Wyrm Caves at level creation.

UnNetHack

In UnNetHack, various worms are generated on each level of the Dragon Caves at level creation.

dNetHack

dNetHack adds several monsters to the monster class:

  • w dark worm
  • w hunting horror
  • w wide clubbed tentacle
  • w worm that walks
  • w parasitic mind flayer
  • w parasitic master mind flayer
  • w long sinuous tentacle
  • w crimson writher

The tentacle 'monsters' in the worm monster class act as "animate" body parts of another monster: they occupy their own square, and can be targeted independently.

Several worms are generated on the locate level of the Drow Noble quest at level creation.

SpliceHack

SpliceHack adds one monster to the monster class:

  • w maggot

EvilHack

EvilHack adds two monsters to the monster class:

  • w giant leech
  • w neothelid

SlashTHEM

In addition to SLASH'EM details, SlashTHEM adds Wormbiter from NetHack: The Next Generation.

Hack'EM

Hack'EM adds many monsters to the monster class, including several from other variants:

  • w larva
  • w maggot
  • w dung worm
  • w acid worm
  • w bloodworm
  • w tunnel worm
  • w rot worm
  • w giant leech
  • w neothelid
  • w hellminth

References

  1. ↑ include/monsym.h in NetHack 3.6.7, line 37
  2. ↑ src/monst.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 911
